content: go along or at least after each square continue by working the second square to the right in the top row as far as round 3 join as you go 1 work round 4 of the second square but only on two sides when you get to the corner on the 2nd side make the 3 dtr then chain 1 and to replace the second chain put your hook through the corresponding corner of the first square and slip_stitch then chain 1 and 3 dtr in the second square 2 slip_stitch into the corresponding space in the first square pull yarn through 3 treble_crochet in second square 3 repeat step 2 to the end of the row in the corner 3 treble_crochet chain 1 slip_stitch into the corner of the first square chain 1 3 treble_crochet continue round 4th side and fasten_off in the last picture above you will see that when i joined the silver round there are three corner spaces cherry rose and plum work a slip_stitch through each space to strengthen the corner i recommend you have a look online at some of the excellent video tutorials of join as you go if you haven t already tried it it is really very easy and quick to work up i worked all along the first row of the grid followed by the second third and so on joining each square as i went along once all 36 squares are joined you will be ready to start the various borders and things get easier it s actually very enjoyable to slowly but steadily work your way round and round seeing the blanket increase in size so to start the first round tip you blanket will lay much flatter and look neater if you turn it over between each round of the border round 1 turn your work on to the wrong side and with colour violet attach yarn to any corner space chain 2 counts as 1 treble_crochet 2tr in same space 3 treble_crochet in next 3 spaces now you will come to the two corners of the granny squares which butt next to each other if you do 3 treble_crochet in each of these adjoining spaces you will end up with too many stitches and the blanket will start to ripple not nice so to avoid that you do a cute little trick in the first corner space do 1 treble_crochet but instead of finishing the stitch stop halfway so it is yarn over insert hook pull through loop 3 loops on hook pull through 2 loops yarn over insert hook pull through loop 4 loops on hook yarn over pull through 4 loops do exactly the same in the adjoining space and you will have two smaller groups of stitches which match the size of the 3 treble_crochet continue along the side of the blanket until you come to the corner then it is 3 treble_crochet 3 chain 3tr work all the way
